projectName: Multi-Tenant SaaS Platform with Project & Task Management
description: A comprehensive dockerized multi-tenant SaaS application with user management, project management, and task tracking. Features RBAC, subscription-based limits, audit logging, and JWT authentication.
features: Multi-tenant architecture with strict data isolation
Comprehensive audit logging for all modifications
Docker Compose orchestration with health checks
Responsive UI with CRUD operations for all resources

superAdmin.description: System administrator with access to all tenants

admin.description: Tenant administrator with full control over the tenant

projects.name: Project Alpha
projects.description: First demo project with sample tasks

projects.name: Project Beta
projects.description: Second demo project with sample tasks

frontend.src/pages: React pages: LoginPage, RegisterPage, DashboardPage, UsersPage, ProjectsPage, TasksPage
frontend.src/components: ProtectedRoute - Route guard for authenticated users
frontend.src/services: API service wrapper for all backend endpoints

backend.src/controllers: Business logic for all 19 API endpoints
backend.src/utils: JWT token utilities and audit logging

scenario1.title: Register New Tenant
steps: Verify admin user created with role 'admin'

scenario2.title: Login and Access Dashboard
steps: Navigate to /dashboard to view tenant statistics

dataValidation.authentication: Zod validation for email, password formats
dataValidation.users: Unique email per tenant, password strength requirements
dataValidation.tasks: Title required, priority and status from enums
dataValidation.subscriptionLimits: maxUsers and maxProjects enforced per tenant

securityFeatures: Role-based access control (RBAC) on all endpoints
Tenant data isolation - users can only access own tenant data

databaseSchema.Tenant: id, name, subdomain, status, subscription (plan), maxUsers, maxProjects, createdAt
databaseSchema.User: id, email, password (hashed), fullName, role, tenantId, createdAt
databaseSchema.Project: id, name, description, status, tenantId, createdAt
databaseSchema.Task: id, title, description, priority, status, projectId, createdAt
databaseSchema.AuditLog: id, userId, tenantId, action, entityType, entityId, changes, createdAt

automatedSetup: Automatic schema migrations via Prisma db push
Seed data creation on first startup
Health check verification before server start
notes: All times are stored in UTC in database
Tokens expire after 24 hours of issuance
Subscription plan determines user and project limits
Tenant admins can only manage their own tenant
Super admin can view all tenants but cannot modify them
Frontend uses localStorage for token persistence
All API responses follow {success, message, data} format
Database automatically initializes on first container startup
